resources.string: Enables AppOps on Android 4.3+ and adds it to the native settings app.

The Xposed Installer is not installed on your system and you are running Android 4.4+. \"%1$s\" is likely disabled, but you may try to launch it using the \"%2$s\" button below. Please note that your device must be rooted to install the Xposed Framework.
Changing these settings may break AppOpsXposed. Use with care!
Show a launcher icon. This is required only if \"App ops\" cannot be launched from your ROM\'s \"Settings\" app.
Use a fix that alleviates layout issues in the per-app \"App ops\" screen.
Use only the minimum patches required for \"App ops\" to work; in this case, a launcher icon must be used. Use this if you experience crashes.
Experimental features. Use at your own risk!

Allows you to control whether an app is allowed to start at boot. This replaces the \"%1$s\" option (which has been merged with the \"%2$s\" option); if \"%1$s\" is currently disabled for an app, it will not boot if you enable this setting and reboot your device!

These features are highly experimental and may cause your phone to get stuck in a boot-loop and become unusable. Use only if you know how to disable Xposed (or this module) from recovery mode or a shell. You have been warned!
Submit via email/Dropbox/Google Drive/etc.; requires root.
Fixes a crash in a system component that prevents \"%1$s\" from loading.
Use an alternate AppOps implementation to improve compatibility on most devices. A launcher icon must be used.
AppOpsXposed is not running as an Xposed module. Install as a system app (requires root)? Device will reboot!
AppOpsXposed is not running as an Xposed module, and root is not available.
These settings have no effect when not running as an Xposed module!
